headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Duties of Police Surgeons--Report Against the Present System of Detailing Officers. POLICE COMMISSIONERS. Discharge of Hotel Thieves--Information Wanted.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board met yesterday, Mayor Wood alone being absent. The minutes of the last day's meeting having been read and confirmed. Mr. BOWEN submitted the following rules and regulations for the government of surgeons of the Police force, which were adopted: RULES AND REGULATIONS FOR THE GOVERNMENT OF THE SURGEONS UP THE METROPOLITAN POLICE.

headline.main: THE MORMON WAR.; Threatenings of Brigham young. Determined Purpose of the Mormons to Resist the United States Troops by Force. Important Correspondenoe from the Utah Expedition.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Washington Union, of yesterday, publishes the following important dispatch from Col. JOHNSTON, of the Army of Utah, inclosing communications from BRIGHAM YOUNG to Col. ALEXANDER, and other documents. We published in yesterday's issue some brief extracts from the correspondence, received by telegraph from Washington:

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Synopsis of the New City Charter. Synopsis of the New City ?? Vaccination in New-York. A NEW COUNTERFEIT STEAMBOAT LANDINGS ON NORTH RIVER. Sea and Ship News.

docs.lead_paragraph: SECTION 1. Continues the Corporation, now existing, and known by the name of "The Mayor, Aldermen and Commonalty of the City of New York" as a body politic and corporate under the same name. SEC. 2 Vests the legislative power of said Corporation in the Aldermen and Councilmen.

docs.lead_paragraph: A DARING BURGLARY IN BROOKLYN.--About 3 o'clock on Sunday morning, grocery store No. 15 Atlantic-street, kept by FREDERICK W. MEYERS, was entered by two burglars, by means of false keys, through the front door. They stole $162, and a gold watch and chain. The proprietor was asleep under the counter at the time the burglars entered, and was aroused by their choking him.

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; Important Mormon Dispatches Intercepted. DEFIANT LETTERS FROM BRIGHAM YOUNG. Interesting Dispatches from Col. Johnston. PROGRESS OF THE UTAH EXPEDITION. His Action Repudiated by the Administration. By Telegraph to the New-York Times. Magnetic Telegraph Co's Offices--No. 43 Wall st., and 181 Broadway IMPORTANT FROM WASHINGTON. Commodore Paulding Denounced for Arresting Walker.

docs.lead_paragraph: Secretary ?? denounces the arrest of WALKER and his ?? by Commodore PAULDING as illegal, inexcusscie and unauthorized. Commodore PAULDING will doubtless be court-martialed immediately. The Commodore's instructions were intended only to direct him to prevent WALKER'S landing.
docs.abstract: Paulding's course repudiated by the Govt
